info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rabun, Macon, Swain and eastern Graham Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Robbinsville to 3 miles southeast of Hiawassee. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Clayton, Bryson City, Robbinsville, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap and Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
